item.title: Accessor Method Error
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

super_:

getInterfaces() resolves the class references to JavaClass objects. it is throwing an exception because runescape_injected.jar is not in Repository’s search paths. use getInterfaceNames()

http://jakarta.apache.org/bcel/apidocs/org/apache/bcel/classfile/JavaClass.html#getInterfaceNames()
I’m not using a JavaClass, that’s just the standard reflection classes I was using.

[quote=“frank_, post:26, topic:387166”]interface name: com.pie.rsbot.updater.hooks.RSClient
it worked for me

you are probably getting an exception, so i suggest actually printing stack traces from your exception handlers[/quote]

try { RSClient c = (RSClient)l.getClient(); System.out.println(c.getMyRSPlayer()); } catch(ClassCastException e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
still gives:

java.lang.ClassCastException: client cannot be cast to com.pie.rsbot.updater.hooks.RSClient at com.pie.rsbot.Program.main(Program.java:35)

Read full topic

item.title: Accessor Method Error
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

http://uppit.com/94rv5mkh1b0a/runescape_injected.jar
^ There is the dumped jar file, opened in winrar, then decompiling the client class with cavaj you can see:

[code]import com.pie.rsbot.updater.hooks.RSClient;
import com.pie.rsbot.updater.hooks.RSPlayer;
import java.awt.;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.lang.reflect.Field;
import java.lang.reflect.Method;
import java.net.Socket;
import java.net.URL;
import java.util.;

public final class client extends jp
implements RSClient
{[/code]

And towards the bottom:

[code]
public int getNumber()
{
return jb;
}

public RSPlayer getMyRSPlayer()
{
    return vaa.x;
}[/code]

However:

ClassLoader clientClassLoader = new URLClassLoader(new URL[] {new File("runescape_injected.jar").toURL()}); Class<?> client = clientClassLoader.loadClass("client"); clientInstance = client.newInstance(); for(Class<?> clazz : client.getInterfaces()) { System.out.println("interface name: "+clazz.getName()); }

Has no output to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Accessor Method Error
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

eczema3:

EDIT: This has worked a few times, before I did something, can’t remember what though.

Oh, so since you used some really good version control like git you can pinpoint the exact cause of your errors, right? You did use version control, didn’t you?

As to your problem, you either didn’t inject the method, didn’t inject the interface (make it implement the interface), or didn’t load the classes correctly. Have you tried dumping the jar and manually verifying that you injected everything correctly?

edit:
Now I see Unhandled beat me to the source control comment…

Read full topic

item.title: Accessor Method Error
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I use the loader from the banks tutorial, slightly modified to incorporate automatic parameter parsing.

[code=java5]package com.pie.rsbot.loader;

import java.applet.Applet;
import java.applet.AppletContext;
import java.applet.AppletStub;
import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLClassLoader;
import java.net.URLConnection;
import java.util.HashMap;
import java.util.regex.Matcher;
import java.util.regex.Pattern;
import java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;

import com.pie.rsbot.updater.Updater;

public class Loader extends JFrame implements AppletStub {

    private static final HashMap<String, String> parameters = new HashMap<String, String>();
    private Object clientInstance;
    
    public Object getClient() {
    	return clientInstance;
    }
    
    private void loadParams() throws Exception {
    	URL u = new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/a2,m0,j0,o0");
    	URLConnection c = u.openConnection();
    	BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(c.getInputStream()));
    	String line = "";
    	String data = "";
    	while((line = in.readLine()) != null) {
    		data += line+"\n";
    	}
    	try {
    		Pattern regex = Pattern.compile("<param name=([^\\s]+)\\s+value=([^>]*)>", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE | Pattern.UNICODE_CASE);
    		Matcher regexMatcher = regex.matcher(data);
    		while (regexMatcher.find())
    			if (!parameters.containsKey(regexMatcher.group(1)))
    				parameters.put(regexMatcher.group(1), regexMatcher.group(2));
    	} catch (PatternSyntaxException ex) {
    		ex.printStackTrace();
    	}
    }
    
    public Loader(Updater u) {
            try {
            	loadParams();
            	System.out.println(parameters);
            	ClassLoader clientClassLoader = new URLClassLoader(new URL[] {new File("runescape_injected.jar").toURL()});
            	Class<?> client = clientClassLoader.loadClass("client");
            	clientInstance = client.newInstance();
                Applet loader = (Applet) clientInstance;
                loader.setStub(this);

                setTitle("Runescape Loader ~ The Bank");
                JPanel theGame = new JPanel(new BorderLayout());
                theGame.setPreferredSize(new Dimension(768, 560));
                setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
                setSize(768, 560);
                loader.init();
                loader.start();
                theGame.add(loader);
                getContentPane().add(theGame, BorderLayout.CENTER);
                setVisible(true);
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
            }
    }

    public void appletResize(int width, int height) { }

    public final URL getCodeBase() {
            try {
                    return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    return null;
            }
    }

    public final URL getDocumentBase() {
            try {
                    return new URL("http://world37.runescape.com/");
            } catch (Exception e) {
                    return null;
            }
    }

    public final String getParameter(String name) {
            return parameters.get(name);
    }

    public final AppletContext getAppletContext() {
            return null;
    }

}[/code]

Read full topic
